backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor with no methods or state.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing implemented features, related files, components, tests, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing the purpose of key frontend files in the project.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base and utility layers plus custom CSS variables defining theme colors and layout tokens for light and dark mode.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that mounts the React app and loads main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React component controlling navigation between the alphabet grid and letter‑specific words page with dynamic header and footer.
frontend/src/components/AlphabetGrid.tsx: Renders a responsive clickable A–Z grid that triggers navigation when a letter is selected.
frontend/src/data/aWords.ts: Static curated list of English words starting with A.
frontend/src/data/letterWords.ts: Unified static dataset mapping each letter A–Z to a curated word list.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook that creates and manages an authenticated or anonymous backend actor, refreshing dependent queries when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Authentication context and hooks for managing Internet Identity login, identity loading, and status tracking.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines global Tailwind layers, typography, and OKLCH color variables for light and dark themes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with React Query and Internet Identity providers, then renders App.
frontend/src/pages/AWordsPage.tsx: Empty placeholder file for the A-words page.
frontend/src/pages/LetterWordsPage.tsx: Renders a words list page for a selected letter with a back button, grid of word cards, and summary section.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind theme extensions including OKLCH color tokens, typography, animations, and plugins.
project_state.json: Stores project metadata, existing features, and requirements for the alphabet and words listing app.
